alert.note: Alert for Bath; Elliott; Fleming; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bath, southeastern Fleming, Rowan and northwestern Elliott Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Polksville, or near Owingsville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Midland around 445 PM EDT. Ramey, Farmers, Freestone, Sharkey and Cogswell around 450 PM EDT. Bluestone, Brandy and Hilda around 455 PM EDT. Munson, Clearfield, Hays Crossing, Pelfrey and Lick Fork around 500 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Morehead, Rodburn, Christy, Cranston, Crix, Waltz, Gates, Vale, Triplett, Wagner, Hamm, Haldeman, Elliottville, Wagner Store and Farley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
